alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 9:31PM MDT until May 12 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following county, El Paso. * WHEN...Until 630 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 929 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the last 24 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area by early Friday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Colorado Springs, Fountain, Monument, Air Force Academy, Manitou Springs, Palmer Lake, Calhan, Ramah, Schriever AFB, Ellicott, Falcon, Peyton, Peterson AFB, Cimarron Hills, Hanover, Security-Widefield, Yoder, Security, Black Forest and Stratmoor. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
